document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Phasmatocoris Breddin from Brazil, and description of the male of Phasmatocoris borgmeieri (Wygodzinsky) (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Emesinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Phasmatocoris Breddin from Brazil, and description of the male of Phasmatocoris borgmeieri (Wygodzinsky) (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Emesinae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–21 .
Phasmatocoris catarinae
sp. nov.
, male holotype, 17, lateral view, 18, head and pronotum, dorsal view, 19, scutellum and metanotum, dorsal view, 20–21, fore leg, inner surface, 20, base of series of spine-like setae on femur, 21, apex of femur, tibia and tarsus, scale bar 1.0 mm.

FIGURES 22–29 .
Phasmatocoris catarinae
sp. nov.
, male holotype, 22, fore wing, scale bar 3.0 mm, 23, hind wing, 24, hind legs, apex of femora and basal portion of tibiae 25–27, genital region, 25, dorsal view, 26, lateral view, 27, posterior view, 28– 29, paramere, scale bar 0.3 mm, 29, apical portion.

FIGURES 30–38 .
Phasmatocoris catarinae
sp. nov.
, male genitalia, 30, phallus, dorsal view, 31–33, articulatory apparatus portions, 31–32, scale bar 0.3 mm, 33, scale bar 0.2 mm, 34, basal plate extension and struts, dorsal view, scale bar 0.4 mm, 35– 38, processes of endosoma, scale bar 0.3 mm, 35, lateral flat process, 36–37, median processes, 38, paired ventral process.

FIGURES 39–42 .
Phasmatocoris catarinae
sp. nov.
, paratype, female, 39, lateral view, 40–41, apex of femur and basal portion of tibia, 40, middle leg, 41, hind leg, 42, genital region, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Brazil , state of Minas Gerais.
Etymology. The new species is named in honor of the Brazilian entomologist, Catarina Macedo Lopes, for her great contribution to medical entomology.

Specimens examined. BRAZIL , Minas Gerais
, Mariana, cave “GS- 41 ”,
06– 16 .VI. 2011
, Bessi et al . leg .,
holotype
,
1 male
, [ MNRJ ]; Rio Acima, cave “qdf_cpmt_ca 3 _cav0007”,
29 .III–01.IV. 2011
, Andrade et al . leg .,
paratype
,
1 female
.

Discussion.
Phasmatocoris catarinae
sp. nov.
can be readily separated from other species of the genus by its larger size: while length of other
Phasmatocoris
species ranges from 6 to 20 mm (
Wygodzinsky 1966
,
Gil-Santana et al . 2007
,
Pape 2013
), the total length of
P. catarinae
sp. nov.
is 22.2 –24.0 mm. The conspicuous markings of the body (
Figs. 17 –22, 24
,
39–41
) is another feature that readily distinguishes
P. catarinae
sp. nov.
from all other congeners.
